author: Beniaminek
title: Woof!
review: For this set you need some jewelry or service and commercial store, so that these diamonds behind the glass have some sense. The glass is opened from the front, but just to be able to put precious stones there when they are blocked by a wall of a shop or something from the back. The building itself disappointed me especially in the construction of the car, because the chassis has ready-mounted wheel axles, which in addition are blocked with plastic on a latch, which I did not want to break, and which protrudes in two places at the bottom. The concept of a summer dog car is very cool, but not for the first set. Very cool, figurines cool, but fun to build so-so: D

author: AllAboutSpeedChampions
title: Lego City 60241
review: This is a great little set and much better than I anticipated. To be honest I really only got this for the dog figure that it comes with. The actual vehicle is blocky and gives me that nostalgic Lego feel and I can see how it is great for small hands to play with. Because it is built with larger moulded pieces it is wonderfully sturdy and all printed pieces so no fiddly stickers. The inclusion of a little window to rob is a nice touch for gameplay. Number Of Pieces: 67 Approximate Price Per Piece: £0.13 Build Time: 5 Minutes

author: Puffypolo
title: Very nice impulsive set
review:
This is a great value set due to its low price. You get 2 minifigs, a car a dog and a stand that can easily be attached to a new building moc or even to inspire a new shop.

Recommended!
